message.content:
We examined the “Sale20240107012” row and noticed that while the text of the invoice clearly says that the sale was done on January 07, 2024, with a unit price equal to the sale total (i.e. the “original” values should be that the sale “amount” and “unit price” are 52961.46 and the date is January 07, 2024), the recorded data does not match. In the row the recorded date is “2024‑01‑15”, the recorded unit price is 44325.13 and the recorded sale total amount is 56945.09. (Other fields – such as profit, payment_mode, etc – are not flagged as inconsistent relative to the textual invoice; we assume they are derived values or not in error.) 

Below is our answer in the requested JSON format. (For any field that we did not find an inconsistency, we output “None”.)

{
  "solution": {
    "Original category": None,
    "Recorded category": None,
    "Original date": "2024-01-07",
    "Recorded date": "2024-01-15",
    "Original payment/receipt_status": None,
    "Recorded payment/receipt_status": None,
    "Original payment_method": None,
    "Recorded payment_method": None,
    "Original quantity": "1.0",
    "Recorded quantity": "1.0",
    "Original price": "52961.46",
    "Recorded price": "44325.13",
    "Original receive_method": None,
    "Recorded receive_method": None,
    "Original amount": "52961.46",
    "Recorded amount": "56945.09",
    "Original tax": None,
    "Recorded tax": None,
    "Original profit": None,
    "Recorded profit": None,
    "Original Preparer": None,
    "Recorded Preparer": None,
    "Original Approver": None,
    "Recorded Approver": None,
    "id": "Sale20240107012"
  }
}
